message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.MM, cs.DS, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
1. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper proposes a P2P Video-on-Demand system that utilizes a distributed network of helpers to minimize server load and adapt to system dynamics. This falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture.
2. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The proposed system is distributed and requires little or no maintenance overhead, which falls under the scope of distributed computing.
3. cs.MM (Multimedia) - The paper deals with video-on-demand systems, which falls under the scope of multimedia.
4. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper proposes two distributed algorithms for solving the problem of helper-user topology, video storage allocation, and bandwidth allocation. This falls under the scope of data structures and algorithms.
5. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The proposed system is adaptable to varying supply and demand patterns across multiple video channels irrespective of video popularity, which falls under the scope of systems and control.
